comments.body: https://finance.yahoo.com/news/singapore-joins-forces-japan-uk-112123053.html?Singapore Joins Forces With Japan, UK and Switzerland on Digital Asset Innovation"The Monetary Authority of Singapore (MAS) announced today that it is collaborating with regulators in Japan, the UK, and Switzerland to advance digital asset innovation through pilots focused on asset tokenization.Under Project Guardian, an initiative led by MAS, the Financial Services Agency of Japan (FSA), the UK's Financial Conduct Authority (FCA) and the Swiss Financial Market Supervisory Authority (FINMA) will work together to facilitate cross-border collaboration and develop common standards around digital assets.The regulators aim to explore legal frameworks, identify potential risks, establish best practices, and promote interoperability in digital asset networks and tokenization. They will also facilitate industry pilots through regulatory sandboxes where applicable."

comments.body: Quote from: safar1980 on October 30, 2023, 07:47:29 PM1. Overview of Business Environments in Singapore and Hong Kong2. Comparative Study of Tax SystemsIndeed, Hong Kong and Singapore have been superior and consistent for decades for investors and companies who want to develop business there. This cannot be separated from the factors and laws that apply in these two countries to companies operating in the crypto sector, such as the tax regime and business mergers for those business people, especially crypto companies, Singapore vs Hong Kong are experts in convincing and attracting many foreign investors.Overall, there are various reviews and insights for investors that must be understood and learned about the legal options that apply whatever type of investment is suitable for them, Hong Kong and Singapore really apply methods according to investors' abilities to run crypto businesses there.Likewise with the tax analysis that applies in Hong Kong and Singapore, they treat the tax rules for crypto companies in a territorial, efficient, competitive manner and at low rates for crypto companies, It's no surprise that the crypto business is growing very fast there, they actually take taxes from real profits, not from total assets, this is what makes many investors interested in doing business in Hong Kong and Singapore.
